result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Joseph Gunderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zachary Joseph Gunderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zachary Joseph Gunderson was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.
Defendant to report to Probation today June 8, 2015.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to probation.
Court grants expungement of 15CF54 upon successful completion of probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

-Random and regular testing.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-MRT Therapy.
-Follow through with any recommended treatment.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Attorney Bannink to have 30 days to calculate credit.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  M. Hartung with student intern Ryan Moertel. DF ATTY:  Lida Marie Bannink DF: Zachary Joseph Gunderson appeared. Case called at 11:06. Includes 15CF54, 15CF190, 15CF198. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct. 1 in 15CF54,  NC to amended charge of misdemeanor bail jumping in Ct. 1 in 15CF190 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF54 and guilty of the amended charge of misdemeanor bail jumping in Ct. 1  15CF190. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 and 3 in 15CF54, Ct. 2,3 and 4 in 15CF190 and 15CF198.  Court questions DE on PSI. Court waives the PSI. Sentencing arguments. De is participating in Programs for Change starting June 11, 2015. 
On 15CF54 count 1
Crt orders: Sentence W/H 3 years probation
Conditions:
- Random and regular testing.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA
- MRT therapy
- Follow through with any recommended treatment. 
- DE to submit to a DNA sample and pay costs and surcharges. 
- Costs
- Apply bond on file. 

On 15CF190 Sentence W/H 1 year probation  
Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
count 1 amended charge
- Costs
Court grants expungement of 15CF54 upon successful completion of probation. 

Atty. Bannink to have 30days to compute credit.  
DE to report to probation today. 
Bond continues pending report.
Plea hearing on June 8, 2015 at 11:00 am.

ADA Hartung responds.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Amber L Hahn DF ATTY: Lida Marie Bannink DF: Zachary Joseph Gunderson appeared from jail. Case called at 9:08. Includes 15CF54, 15CF190, 15CF198. Court reviews file. Atty. Bannink updates the court. DE is scheduled for orientation on 05-19-2015. ADA Hahn responds. Atty. Bannink responds. Court grants a furlough to get orientation completed on 05-19-2015. DE to return with a written treatment plan after orientation. DE to be released 45 min. prior to treatment and under amended bond at that time. All threee files will have the same bond of signature bond of  $500. Amended bond will include all conditions of previous bond.

 SIGNATURE BOND:  Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $500.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

-Random Testing ot upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

- Report every  Monday, Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Riley P. or Spencer C.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- DE is to follow treatment recommended by the program. 

- St. Croix County Jail is to be notified by treatment facility if DE does not show for treatment, absconds from treatment, or doesn't show commitment to the program.

and   _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $750.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

-Random Testing ot upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

- Report every  Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Riley P. or Spencer C.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
